sections.title: Definition
content: Average = Sum of Observations / Number of Observations

sections.title: Grouped Averages
content: Average = A1, Sum of Observations = S1, Number of Observations = N1
Average = A2, Sum of Observations = S2, Number of Observations = N2
sections.note: If Group 1 and Group 2 are combined, the average becomes A = (S1 + S2) / (N1 + N2)

sections.title: Replacement Problems
content: If the average of a group of N people changes by P kg when a person with weight W kg is replaced, then:
- If average increases: New person’s weight = W + P × N
- If average decreases: New person’s weight = W − P × N
sections.example: The average weight of 5 persons decreases by 2 kg when a 50 kg man is replaced. New person's weight = 50 − (5 × 2) = 40 kg
